title: 109_s3583
content: REGULATION OF PAYROLL TAX DEPOSIT AGENTS: An amendment to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 adds a new section regarding payroll tax deposit agents. The Secretary will establish a system for registration and renewal of payroll tax deposit agents, including fees, bonding or audits options, required disclosures, and direct notification to employers by tax authorities. The system for registration and renewal of payroll tax deposit agents will include required disclosures, direct notification to employers by tax authorities, and penalties for unregistered agents. A payroll tax deposit agent is defined as a person providing payroll processing or tax services to employers with authority to access funds for tax deposits. A payroll tax deposit agent provides payroll processing or tax services to employers with authority to access funds for tax deposits. They must submit a bond of $50,000 to $500,000 determined by the Secretary. The bond amount for a payroll tax deposit agent must be between $50,000 and $500,000, determined by the Secretary. The bond or security must comply with regulations, and an annual audit must be conducted by an independent third party based on specific principles set by the Secretary. The payroll tax deposit agent's escrow account is balanced yearly to reconcile quarterly statements. Funds are not mixed with operating funds, not used for agent's costs, and evidence of tax payments is required. The Secretary mandates disclosure of client liabilities and verification mechanisms for tax deposits. The Secretary mandates disclosure of client liabilities and verification mechanisms for tax deposits, including the ability to make federal tax deposits, file tax returns, and access confidential tax information. Regulations will be prescribed to carry out these provisions. The Secretary will prescribe regulations for individuals who can sign and file federal employment tax returns on behalf of a taxpayer and have access to confidential tax information. Payroll tax deposit agents will be subject to penalties for failure to collect and pay over tax. The amendments regarding payroll tax deposit agents will take effect upon the enactment of the Act, with penalties applying for failures after that date.
